name: Anderson, Mark S.
title: A.W. and Mary Margaret Clausen Distinguished Professor of Metabolism and Endocrinology; Director, UCSF Diabetes Center
notes: MD, PhD from University of Chicago. Elected to National Academy of Medicine in 2020. Director of UCSF Diabetes Center since 2022. Leading researcher in immune tolerance and autoimmune disease, particularly on the transcription factor AIRE. Received two CIRM awards totaling ~$2.5 million for stem cell research.

name: Arscott, David Gifford
title: Principal / Co-Founder
ngos: Western Association of Venture Capitalists (President, 1977); National Venture Capital Association; American Electronics Association; Calvary Presbyterian Church deacon; Trinity Parish vestry clerk
notes: Born March 7, 1944, Princeton NJ. B.A. History and Economics, College of Wooster (1966); MBA Finance, University of Michigan (1968). VP and General Manager at Citicorp Venture Capital, San Francisco (1967-1978); Managing General Partner at Arscott Norton & Associates, Palo Alto (1978-1988); Principal at Compass Technology Partners, Atherton (1988-present). Board Director of Lam Research Corporation for over 30 years, retiring 2011. Early backer of Lam Research, introduced founder David Lam to Bob Noyce.

name: Austrian, Robert 'Boz'
title: Executive Director, Client Specialist, Private Wealth Management
notes: Known as 'Bob' Austrian. 30+ year Wall Street veteran in institutional and personal investing. Previously Portfolio Manager and Product Specialist at Neuberger Berman (2011-2014); prior career as equity research analyst at Bank of America, Merrill Lynch, and Morgan Stanley covering software technology sector. MBA from New York University Stern School of Business.

name: Bell, Martin T.
notes: Martin David Bell (CA Bar #109000) was admitted to the California Bar in 1983, graduated from Western State University California; license went inactive in 2019.

name: Belonick, Paul
employer: University of California, College of the Law, San Francisco (UC Law SF)
title: Professor of Practice; Director, Startup Legal Garage; Assistant Director, Center for Innovation
notes: PhD in Roman, Greek and American Legal History and JD from University of Virginia School of Law (2010), where he was Editor-in-Chief of Virginia Law Review and member Order of the Coif. Law clerk on the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals (2013-2014). Previously Associate at Sidley Austin LLP (2014-2018). CA Bar #298055 (2014). Published book on fall of Roman Republic (2022). Teaches First Amendment, Criminal Investigations, Patent Law, Property, Legal Ethics.

name: Benway, Randall
title: Assistant Director and Pianist
notes: San Francisco-based concert pianist, accompanist, teacher and adjudicator. Assistant director and pianist for the Blackhawk Chorus since 2009. Founding member of the Redwood Trio. B.M. from Hartt College of Music; M.M. (piano) from University of Michigan, studying with Gyorgy Sandor and Louis Nagel; composition with William Bolcom. Studied piano with Balint Vazsonyi in London and composition with Nadia Boulanger in Fontainebleau, France. Performed as soloist with orchestras in the US, Europe, and Asia including live NPR radio broadcasts.

name: Blumenkranz, Mark
title: H.J. Smead Professor Emeritus, Ophthalmology; Co-Director, Ophthalmic Innovation Program, Byers Eye Institute
ngos: RD Fund (Retinal Degeneration Fund) Board of Directors; Trustee and Fellow, Corporation of Brown University (2002-2019); American University Professors of Ophthalmology (AUPO, past President); Retina Society (past President); Macula Society (past President)
notes: Born October 23, 1950. MD and MMS from Brown University (undergraduate, master's in biochemical pharmacology, and MD). Chair, Stanford Department of Ophthalmology (1997-2015). Holder of 18 U.S. patents. Co-founded and served as chairman of Adverum Biotechnologies (NASDAQ: ADVM) until 2016. Founded or co-founded Optimedica Corp., Oculeve Corp., Verana Health, Macusight, Peak Surgical, Digisight, Kedalion. Board member of One Medical (NASDAQ: ONEM) and Iveric Bio.

name: Brennan, Craig D.
title: Chief Executive Officer
notes: Previously CEO of Switchfly Inc. (travel ecommerce SaaS), San Francisco (2019-2023). Prior roles: CEO at Brio Software; CEO at Overtone; CEO at QuickMobile (sold to Cvent); SVP CRM at Oracle; Partner at Deloitte Consulting leading worldwide Siebel CRM Practice; Associate Partner at Accenture. Board director at YourMembership.com. MBA from Kellogg School of Management, Northwestern University; BA from University of Michigan.

name: Brink, Benjamin McAlester
title: Managing Partner
political_donations: Republican. Congressional nominee CA District 14 (1994, 1996); Member California Republican Central Committee; Member Santa Clara County Republican Central Committee; Member San Mateo County Republican Central Committee.
notes: Education: BS Mathematics and MS Operations Research, Stanford University; MBA, Harvard Business School; MS Strategic Studies, U.S. Army War College. Served as Assistant Public Printer of the United States (brought new biometric US passport into production). Captain in the Navy Reserve; recalled to active duty 2007-2009, deployed to Afghanistan, led intelligence sharing between Afghanistan, Pakistan, and ISAF â€” awarded the Bronze Star. CEO of several tech companies including Exegy (real-time market data) and AP Materials.

name: Carter, Todd
title: Managing Director and Chairman, Global Technology; Board Director
ngos: The Conservation Fund (Board Director); Education SuperHighway (Board)
notes: Appointed to Houlihan Lokey Board of Directors May 2022. Previously Co-CEO and Co-Founder of GCA Advisors (acquired by Houlihan Lokey in 2021); Chairman, President and CEO of Savvian and Perseus Group (GCA predecessors); President of Robertson Stephens investment bank; Consultant at McKinsey & Company. Board Director of Modivcare Inc. (NASDAQ: MODV). 1,000+ M&A transactions over 30-year career. B.A. University of Texas; MBA Harvard Business School.

name: Chalberg, Thomas Walter Jr.
title: Founder and CEO
notes: Born August 22, 1977. PhD in Genetics, Stanford University School of Medicine; MBA, UC Berkeley Haas School of Business. Founded and was CEO of Avalanche Biotechnologies (NASDAQ IPO 2014, resigned 2015). Previously Group Product Manager at Genentech. Managing Director at Heroic Ventures (life sciences). Partner at Polymerase Capital. Board Director: iRenix Medical (Executive Chairman), Ethris GmbH, Chameleon Biosciences. CIRM award recipient ($11.6 million for Genascence knee OA gene therapy trial). World Economic Forum contributor.

name: Cheng, Gregory
employer: Ogletree, Deakins, Nash, Smoak & Stewart, P.C.
title: Shareholder; Member, Board of Directors
notes: CA Bar #226865 (2003). Management-side labor and employment law specialist in San Francisco office. Joined Ogletree Deakins in 2006. JD from Rutgers School of Law - Newark (2003). Selected to Super Lawyers Rising Stars 2013-2018. Member of firm's Board of Directors.

name: Conte, David
title: Professor of Composition; Chair, Composition Department
ngos: American Composers Forum (Board Member, 2011-2017; Program Committee)
notes: Born December 20, 1955. American composer. Faculty at San Francisco Conservatory of Music since 1985. Conductor of Conservatory Chorus (2000-2014). Named American Guild of Organists Composer of the Year 2024 for biennial AGO national convention. Has written over 150 works published by E.C. Schirmer including six operas. Fulbright scholar in Paris; Ralph Vaughan Williams Fellow; Aspen Music Festival Conducting Fellow. Previously on faculty at Cornell, Colgate University, Keuka College, and Interlochen Center for the Arts. Composer in Residence with Cappella SF.

name: Crawford, Bradley Cort
title: Shareholder; Administrative Shareholder, San Francisco Office
notes: CA Bar #178403 (1995). Banking and leveraged finance attorney. Previously partner at Bingham McCutchen LLP. Represents lenders in financing and debt securities issuance. B.S. Business Administration (Finance), UC Berkeley; JD from law school. Ranked in The Best Lawyers in America (Banking and Finance Law, 2013-2022) and Lawyer of the Year 2020. Ranked in Chambers USA California Banking & Finance (2013-2021). Prior career in money center banks marketing corporate finance to middle-market companies.

name: Crawford, J. Brooks M.D.
title: Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology (Emeritus); former Director, Ocular Pathology Service
ngos: American Board of Ophthalmology (Board Director 1986-1993; Chairman 1993); American Ophthalmological Society (President, 2004)
notes: Dr. Joseph Brooks Crawford, MD. Graduated UCSF 1960. Director of Ocular Pathology Service at UCSF (1972-2012). Donated ophthalmology examination equipment to St. Anthony Foundation Medical Clinic in San Francisco upon retirement from private practice. NPI #1831141712. Office at 10 Koret Way (UCSF), San Francisco.

name: Davis, Erik S.
title: Independent Author, Journalist and Scholar
notes: Born 1967, Redwood City, California. PhD. Author of TechGnosis: Myth, Magic and Mysticism in the Age of Information (Crown, 1998; republished North Atlantic Press); High Weirdness: Drugs, Esoterica, and Visionary Experience in the Seventies (MIT Press); The Visionary State: A Journey through California's Spiritual Landscape (Chronicle, 2006); Led Zeppelin IV (33 1/3 series); Nomad Codes (2010). Award-winning journalist who wrote for Village Voice, Spin, Details, Rolling Stone, and Wired. Faculty at Esalen Institute. Has taught at UC Berkeley, UC Davis, California Institute of Integral Studies, and Rice University. Based in San Francisco.

name: Dini, Robert Louis
title: Real Estate Agent
notes: Robert Louis 'Bob' Dini (January 4, 1932 - August 30, 2025). 35-year career with Coldwell Banker in San Francisco, Boston, Winchester MA, and San Marino CA. Prior career in advertising (McCann Erickson, then own firm Dini Advertising). In the 1990s pursued acting, appearing in over 10 films including Down Periscope (with Kelsey Grammer) and Copycat. Settled in San Marino, CA in 2004. Remained active in real estate until his death.

name: Donaho, Brazos A.
title: Co-Founder and CEO
notes: Born 1960, Burlingame, CA. Previously Founder and President of Brazos Software (Document Management services and products including 'Brazos Bridge'). Prior career as Financial Industry Expert at EDS, leading early client/server development for next-generation banking systems. B.S. Finance, Texas A&M University.
